title: "Air Dragon is useless over other Elementals"
body:
Perhaps if you consider the buff kicking in during a 7s chase, and you're suddenly overwhelmed by that slower individual coming back into range for the kill, you might reconsider what "out of combat" type buffs can really accomplish.

That and even Air stacks boost the power of the Elder Dragon DoT buff, so just keep all Elementals out of enemy hands.

replies.body: So, your argument is that you should get it so that you can chase kills better? Because if I'm chasing you for 7 seconds and haven't done any damage to you, I should probably be letting you go anyway.

To me, most of the dragons are nearly worthless, _on their own_. It's much better to combine them and get multiple buffs, and even then, it takes at least two. 

To me, Water and Air are a great combination as they grant safety, and Fire and Earth combine well to take towers and future objectives. 

However, getting just a single buff of one type feels a bit lack luster. If you ever get three of the same one though: **_HOLY SHIT IS THE POWER REAL_**

Three Water dragons is absurd when you decide you need to keep fighting, and the three Earth dragons will turn any team into a siege comp. Three Fire is a nearly free Rabadons passive, and three Air makes a mobilty boot enchantment, _on top of your actual boots_.

So to me, the dragons are nearly worthless on their own, and no matter what, you should always prefer that _you_ get the buffs instead of the enemy team.

people are stupid and they go "HERES THE ORDER OF POWER NEVER DISAGREE"
the reason people think wind is so weak is because its a power that comes in useful over the whole game but not as much as the others.
For example in laning phase water is the strongest with wind being 2nd and earth and fire being last this is because in lane sustain matter and the wind helps catches people off and gives the jungler an easyier time to pull off ganks and the pure movespeed based junglers (like shyvana yi udyr and voil) who all take this dragon really fast want this the most thats why some people who play those champs use movespeed quints.

When your approaching mid game it be something like earth wind fire and then water. at this point you are doing full out battles to the death so water doesnt matter anymore so it goes to last place. fire is starting to come into effect but you dont have that much ap/ad so its still pretty minor. earth is the most impact because it allows you to take the objects which is what mid game is focused around and wind is the 2nd best because it allows you to make picks and engages to get those objectives.

As we go around to late game the order becomes fire wind earth and water.
fire because now everyone is getting their items so it starts showing its power.
wind because its allow you to pick someone out and then force a teamfight and win.
earth starts becoming less useful because generally late game if you win a fight you won the game.
and water becomes useless due to you know having to care about sustain because the fights are either you live or you die.

but people dont want to think about the game they are just like "herp de derp give me tier list for champions, buffs, objectives, dragons if its not in a tier list i dont care"

Not sure about you, but I've seen teamfights stalled so the teams just poke each other til someone goes in to initiate, making water incredibly effective to prevent your team from getting poked down low enough. Wind seems useless because the utility is much harder to appreciate, you're almost never going to realize that because you weren't hit for a few seconds you sped up and got away, and unless you got at least two wind dragons you'll never even feel much of a difference unless it's an incredibly long chase.

if they are poking they are in combat thats why its useless in combat is classed as hitting someone as well as being hit so thats why water dragon is pretty useless the reason wind is good is because people like j4 cant waste their eq just to simply get a bit closer but wind gives him the speed needed to use them effectively.

Assuming you have more than one wind, and assuming you stay in combat after poking, which is not what poking is. You poke/get poked, stay back and heal while your opponents get withered down. You have to commit to a fight if the enemy has water because they can retreat a short bit and heal up.
I would say an air dragon is only good if you have two or three of them, it's not worth contesting and dying for, more of a luxury.

the biggest issue of air dragon is that out of combat ms is very weak unless it comes in bigger numbers.
A single air drake means nothing, exept for the aditional truedamage if you get the elder dragon.
15 ms just doesn't make enough of a difference if it requires 5 sec out of combat. it will hardly help at escapeing or chaseing, and it's not enough to out rotate anyone.
Now if you have all 3 air drakes, it looks different. 45 ms is enough to make the difference in thos scenarios, and if you get elder for the full 67.5, you have massive advantage on a coordinated team, as you will move around the map ~20% faster than your opponents, allowing for good rotations, flanks, picks and so on.

The reason people think Air dragon is useless is because it fills a niche that the others don't. You always attack enemy champions, so Fire dragon is always useful. You almost always attack structures and epic monsters, so Earth dragon is almost always useful. You're always out of combat at some point, so Water dragon is always useful. You are rarely being chased for a long period of time to activate the out of combat movement speed, so Air dragon is rarely useful. Simple as that.
